categories.title: Tech Discussions and Projects by dankvr and shawmakesmagic

content.text: dankvr recommends Brave browser as a better alternative with easy migration of extensions and bookmarks, mentioning no issues with crypto wallets like Metamask and Rabby.

dankvr discusses the importance of hackerspaces and maker culture, highlighting Shenzhen as an embodiment of this culture at city scale. He emphasizes the need for more 'third spaces' for builders in the US and mentions projects like RepRap (a self-replicating 3D printer) as potential breakthroughs.

dankvr shares a story about a software engineer whose team was let go after hiring a data specialist, emphasizing that data preparation is an 'unassuming, tedious, often overlooked' process that gives AI an edge.
dankvr previews an upcoming AI show following 'Clank Tank', mentioning that the script was generated by Claude and that he'll create a guide for collaborative cinematic content creation.

elizaOS promotes their Developer YouTube channel featuring agent demos, plugin tutorials, and developer deep dives. They highlight plugins as what makes elizaOS personalized and showcase integration with Hedera and Pear Protocol.

shawmakesmagic announces the conclusion of 'Remilio Corporation Autonomous Agent Experiment #433' and the upcoming deletion of the account. He also shares 'Clank Tank Episode 2' and a video titled 'THE COUNCIL'.

shawmakesmagic proposes a new AI benchmark: getting models to create an image of a person with no nose, suggesting it's 'an incredibly dumb jailbreak that always works'. He also compares Grok's responses to other AI models.

categories.title: Recent ElizaOS GitHub Pull Requests Summary

content.text:
## Code Organization and Plugin Management

Several PRs focus on reorganizing code and improving plugin management:

- Ollama code has been removed from LocalAI and moved to a separate plugin (#4122, #4121)
- Audio utilities have been moved to core for better reusability (#4133)
- Browser plugin has been cleaned up by removing duplicate code (#4129)
- Unused packages have been removed (#4135)
- Plugin publishing workflow has been enhanced with better GitHub repository push functionality and support for `@elizaos/plugin` prefix aliasing (#4132)

## Bug Fixes and Improvements

Multiple PRs address various bugs and make improvements:

- Docker image size has been reduced by ~0.4GB through package optimization, removing redundant installations, and improving layer caching (#4120)
- Telegram integration has been enhanced with better room and entity synchronization for supergroups with forum topics (#4124)
- Fixed issues with starter project and audio utility imports (#4139)
- Fixed browserify-stream import (#4138)
- Fixed entity synchronization (#4137)
- Fixed payload sent to event handler for `MESSAGE_SENT` (#4131)
- Fixed Plugin EVM tests (#4130)
- Removed messageHandlerTemplate phase from bootstrap to speed up replies (#4126)

## New Features

Several new features have been added:

- OpenAI plugin now allows choosing custom embedding models with the addition of `OPENAI_EMBEDDING_MODEL` and `OPENAI_EMBEDDING_DIMENSIONS` environment variables (#4140)
- Telegram integration has been enhanced with middleware support (#4125, #4128)
- Added Telegram community manager functionality to greet new users and timeout users (#4134)
- Added Raiinmaker plugin variables to .env.example (#4136)

## Dependency Updates

Dependencies have been updated for security and performance:

- Bumped dompurify from 3.2.3 to 3.2.4 to fix a conditional and config dependent mXSS-style bypass
- Bumped katex from 0.16.20 to 0.16.21 to fix a security issue with \htmlData attribute name escaping

## Email Changes

Additional email-related changes have been made (#4123), though specific details were not provided in the PR description.

Several documentation updates have been made to improve the user experience with custom plugins. PR #3736 updated the README.md with a how-to guide for custom plugins, while PR #3735 updated the plugins.md file specifically for custom plugins not in the registry. Additionally, PR #3729 expanded the documentation with a blog, showcase, changelog, and RSS features.

Several new features have been implemented, including an enhanced avatar stack (PR #4162), the addition of node_modules to .gitignore (PR #4161), replacement of eventEmitter3 with Evt (PR #4149), and a cleaned API (PR #4144).

Multiple bug fixes have been implemented, addressing issues with grammar and createVerifiableLogApiRouter guard (PR #3707), splitText functionality (PR #3653), PGlite migration (PR #4158), cache interaction cursor and duplicate memory creation (PR #4155), Twitter integration and server crashes (PR #4151), project plugin loading (PR #4150), and database transaction deadlocks (PR #4142). Test files were also fixed according to comments in PR #4130.

Other improvements include better Farcaster configuration handling (PR #4156), an update to the temporary hardcoded v2 registry (PR #4153), addition of Raiinmaker to .env.example (PR #4136), and extensive UI tests (PR #4092).

## ElizaOS Technical Support

The ElizaOS support channel focused on several technical issues and solutions:

### Plugin Integration Issues
- Multiple users struggled with Telegram and Twitter plugin integration
- Common solutions included correct installation commands (`npx elizaos plugins add @elizaos-plugins/client-telegram` and `npx elizaos plugins add @elizaos-plugins/client-twitter`)
- Users needed to update character JSON files with proper plugin references
- Confusion between "client" and "plugin" naming conventions was resolved

### Database Configuration
- Questions about PostgreSQL as memory provider were raised
- MongoDB adapter was found to be unsupported in current beta (only pglite and PostgreSQL supported)
- RAG knowledge updates required manual deletion of db.sqlite to take effect
- Custom PostgreSQL queries and schema usage were requested

### Agent Behavior
- Issues with agents responding with both action and default responses
- Successful use of hybrid provider setup combining Anthropic and OpenAI for embeddings
- Implementation of recurring tasks using runtime.getTasks and runtime.getTaskWorker

### OpenRouter Integration
- Multiple users discussed the lack of an official OpenRouter plugin
- A hacky version for Eliza v2 was shared but had publishing issues
- Workarounds for uploading knowledge files using custom JS scripts were provided

## Auto.fun Launch Discussion

The discussion centered around the delayed launch of auto.fun:

### Launch Delay Rationale
- The delay was attributed to extended testing and backend coordination, not new partner additions
- The team prioritized quality and stability over speed
- Focus on improving release predictability in the future

### Community Perspectives
- Some members questioned adding partners while bugs still exist
- Others defended the quality-first approach to avoid launching with subpar projects
- Team contributions were highlighted: documentation overhauls, automation tools, demo events

### Launch Strategy
- Staggered release approach was hinted at
- Emphasis on backend readiness and partner integration
- Quality control to maintain credibility and avoid "shitcoins"

## Token Trading and Analysis

The channel featured extensive discussion about token trading on Solana-based platforms:

### Trading Strategies
- Coordinated community efforts to push specific tokens to reach KOTH (King of the Hill) status
- Real-time tracking of market cap, floor prices, and holder counts
- Discussion of token meta trends (e.g., "titty and ghib meta")
- Narrative alignment with current events (OnlyFans AI, Nintendo news) driving token performance

### Technical Implementation
- Use of pump.fun links for tracking and promotion
- Real-time monitoring of metrics to coordinate buys
- Social media integration to amplify token visibility
- Community pooling of SOL to influence token floors and rankings

### Token Issues
- One user had to relaunch a token after misspelling errors
- Discussion of suspicious token dumps attributed to whales
- Speculation about bot-driven trading glitches on exchanges

## DegenAI/Spartan V2 Development

Brief updates on the DegenAI/Spartan project development:

### V2 Progress
- Team actively working on feature parity with V1 while improving stability
- New project name approved and secured
- Coordination with marketing team for high-impact launch
- Expected release within 1-2 weeks

### User Experience Improvements
- Community feedback about making the Spartan AI bot more friendly
- Previous version was perceived as rude
- Development team acknowledged the feedback

### Partner Benefits
- Clarification that partners do not receive allocations or special benefits from the launchpad

## Hyperfy v0.10.0 Release

A major update to the Hyperfy engine was announced with over 80 improvements:

### Key Technical Features
- New streamlined UI
- World menu for admins to customize environments, avatars, and spawn points
- Transform gizmo for precise object manipulation
- Support for interleaved buffer geometry and controller support
- New mod/plugin hooks (experimental)
- Ability to load models from URLs dynamically
- Enhanced UI layout controls (margins, padding, flex)
- Fixes for VR button issues, octree memory usage, and race conditions in VRM uploads

### Social Media Automation
- Discussion of suspended automated Twitter/X accounts used for DAO news
- Attempts to recover or acquire accounts ongoing
- Script in place to automate news posts (previously achieved 100k views)

Current cryptocurrency prices show significant variations across major tokens. Wrapped Bitcoin (WBTC) is trading between $82,444.97 and $85,119.08, showing an upward trend. Wrapped Ethereum (WETH) is priced between $1,822.83 and $1,905.85, also displaying positive movement. Solana (SOL) is trading in the $124.53 to $126.68 range. The ai16z token is currently valued between $0.16 and $0.20, showing the largest percentage increase among the listed cryptocurrencies.

categories.title: Recent Pull Requests in the elizaOS/eliza Repository

content.text:
Several pull requests have been submitted to the elizaOS/eliza repository addressing various features and fixes:

- PR #3733 by Tony363 successfully implemented request functionality
- PR #3735 by Xayaan updated the plugins.md documentation to include information about custom plugins not in the registry
- PR #4149 by wtfsayo replaced eventEmitter3 with Evt for event handling
- PR #4151 by wtfsayo fixed issues with Twitter integration and resolved a double memory creation attempt that was causing server crashes
- PR #4162 by tcm390 enhanced the avatar stack functionality
- PR #4150 by wtfsayo fixed an issue related to project plugin loading order, specifically addressing starter project concerns

Two issues have been identified in the ElizaOS repository:

1. The first issue (#4119) concerns an API endpoint 'router.post('/:agentId/rooms')' that lacks proper annotations and handles multiple scenarios, making it difficult to understand and maintain. The lack of documentation is causing confusion for developers working with this endpoint.

2. The second issue (#4127) details a problem with the Twitter plugin repeatedly checking the same tweets and mentions in a loop, even after they've been processed. This creates unnecessary API calls to Twitter (risking rate limiting), generates excessive log entries, and increases system load. The logs show the same tweets being checked and skipped multiple times. Suggested solutions include implementing cursor-based pagination, storing the last checked tweet ID, or adding a proper caching mechanism with TTL for processed tweets.

Recent development efforts have focused on package improvements, including cleanup of the browser plugin and adding a separate Ollama plugin. New features were implemented, such as enhancing Telegram functionality and the Ollama plugin integration. The team fixed 3 bugs across the projects. A total of 15 contributors collaborated to merge 14 PRs. Major work included various improvements across the codebase.
sources: text: Development focused on package improvements (add separate ollama plugin), new features (add separate ollama plugin), 1 bug fixes. with 5 contributors merging 3 PRs. Major work included various improvements.

text: Development focused on package improvements (Cleanup browser plugin), new features (Enhance telegram), 2 bug fixes. with 10 contributors merging 11 PRs. Major work included various improvements.

content.text: The elizaos/eliza repository showed increased activity between March and April 2025. In early March (March 1-2), there were 7 new PRs with 5 merged and no new issues, with 16 active contributors. By early April (April 2-3), activity had increased significantly with 16 new PRs (14 merged), 7 new issues, and 18 active contributors. This represents a notable growth in both contributions and contributor engagement over this one-month period.
sources: From 2025-03-01 to 2025-03-02, elizaos/eliza had 7 new PRs (5 merged), 0 new issues, and 16 active contributors.
From 2025-04-02 to 2025-04-03, elizaos/eliza had 16 new PRs (14 merged), 7 new issues, and 18 active contributors.
